DOC.brief_summary: To measure compare pain associated venipuncture peripheral intravenous catheter insertion among pediatric emergency department patient randomize treatment one three different pain-reduction strategy : J-Tip速 jet injection 1 % buffered lidocaine , J-Tip速 jet injection sterile saline , application 4 % lidocaine topical cream . The investigator hypothesize J-Tip速 jet injection 1 % buffered lidocaine provide superior local anesthesia compare saline lidocaine cream .
DOC.brief_title: J-Tip速 Jet Injection 1 % Buffered Lidocaine Saline Versus 4 % Lidocaine Cream Before Venipuncture IV Insertion
DOC.criteria: Children age seven twentyone year old requiring venipuncture PIVC insertion part emergency department care eligible study . Lidocaine allergy , TegadermTM allergy , Glasgow Coma Score ( GCS ) less 15 , Pain propose site procedure , Requirement PIVC venipuncture immediately due illness acuity , Inability complete selfreported pain scale ( VAS , visual analogue scale ) , Patients speak understand English , OR Previous enrollment study .
